Package shirmin

Class Event

  • java.lang.Object
    • shirmin.Task
      • shirmin.Event
  • public class Event
extends Task
    Represents an event, represented by a description string and two LocalDateTime objects - from and to

    • Constructor Detail

      • Event

        public Event​(java.lang.String description,
             java.lang.String from,
             java.lang.String to)
        Creates an Event object with a description, start time, and end time.

        The start and end times are parsed from strings into LocalDateTime objects. If parsing fails, both 'from' and 'to' are set to null.

        Parameters:
        description - Description of the event.
        from - String representing the start time of the event, expected in "yyyy-MM-dd HHmm" format.
        to - String representing the end time of the event, expected in "yyyy-MM-dd HHmm" format.

    • Method Detail

      • getFrom

        public java.lang.String getFrom()
        Returns a string representation of the start time of the event.

        The format of the returned string is "MMM dd yyyy HH:mm".

        Returns:
        Formatted string of the 'from' LocalDateTime field, or null if 'from' is null.

      • getTo

        public java.lang.String getTo()
        Returns a string representation of the end time of the event.

        The format of the returned string is "MMM dd yyyy HH:mm".

        Returns:
        Formatted string of the 'to' LocalDateTime field, or null if 'to' is null.

      • hasValidDates

        public java.lang.Boolean hasValidDates()
        Checks if both start date and end date are set for an event.

        This method returns a Boolean value indicating whether both 'from' and 'to' LocalDateTime fields in the current object instance are instantiated (not null). It helps in determining if the event has a valid date range.

        Returns:
        true if both 'from' and 'to' date-time fields are non-null, false otherwise

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of the Event.

        The format includes the type of task ('[E]'), the description, and the formatted 'from' and 'to' times. Example: "[E][âœ“] Meeting (from: Oct 12 2021 10:00 to: Oct 12 2021 11:00)"

        Overrides:
        toString in class Task
        Returns:
        String representing the Event with its status, description, and time range.
